title: 18 Year analysis of RASFF notifications on Sudan dye adulterated cases in palm oil (2004 to 2022) and the principles of the technique for its detection

Regina Nyorkeh, Ernest Teye, Edward Ken Essuman, Simon A. Haughey, Natasha Logan, Christopher T. Elliott
Palm oil is one of the most widely consumed food products globally. Despite the restriction of Sudan dyes as a food colouring agent, these dyes still feature prominently in palm oil adulteration, which occurs in most developing countries.
